summary: Email exchange between Alex Conlon (attorney) and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding scheduling a meeting with a female client for the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The email discusses logistical details, note-taking, and the expectation that the upcoming meeting will cover difficult topics including Epstein's conduct with a specific individual.

persons.name: Alex Conlon
persons.context: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP corresponding with a federal prosecutor about scheduling a meeting with a client for the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Alexandra Elenowitz-Hess
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence between Alex Conlon and the Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein investigation meeting.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the SDNY investigation, with the upcoming meeting expected to cover his conduct with a particular individual.

connections.description: Alex Conlon is an attorney involved in correspondence regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, representing a client being interviewed.
Both are copied on the email correspondence regarding the Epstein investigation scheduling.

events.title: Email scheduling investigation meeting
events.description: Email exchange to schedule a meeting between a female client and SDNY prosecutors to discuss the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, with plans for the client to make phone calls to two individuals.

events.title: Planned difficult interview topics
events.description: Prosecutors indicate the next meeting with the client will address difficult topics, including Giglio subjects and a review of Epstein's conduct with a particular individual.

locations: Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP, 350 Fifth Avenue, Suite 7110, New York, New York
keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was active in May 2019, with prosecutors scheduling interviews with individuals.
Prosecutors planned to discuss 'difficult topics, including Giglio subjects and some review of Epstein's conduct with [a particular individual]' in an upcoming meeting.
A female client, represented by attorney Alex Conlon, was expected to make phone calls to two individuals on behalf of the investigation.
The email correspondence shows coordination between defense counsel and federal prosecutors regarding witness interviews and evidence gathering.
